greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest m such that A002110(n) + m is prime.
comment: Any composite a(n) would disprove Fortune's conjecture, see A005235. - _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Oct 31 2003
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = 1 for n=0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 11, 75, ... (A014545); a(n) = A005235(n) otherwise. - _Jeppe Stig Nielsen_, Oct 31 2003
maple: p:= proc(n) option remember; `if`(n<1, 1, p(n-1)*ithprime(n)) end:
mathematica: nmax=2^16384; npd=1;n=1;npd=npd*Prime[n]; While[npd<nmax, tt=1; cp=npd+tt; While[ !(PrimeQ[cp]), tt=tt+2;cp=cp+2]; Print[tt]; n=n+1; npd=npd*Prime[n]] (* _Lei Zhou_, Feb 15 2005 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, May 02 2000
ext: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 16 2020
